identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of OV101 in Individuals With Fragile X Syndrome
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel-Group Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of OV101 in Fragile X Syndrome

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety, tolerability and efficacy of oral OV101 (gaboxadol) in subjects with Fragile X syndrome.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE)
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of Participants with Treatment Emergent Adverse Events

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Is male and 13 to 22 years old (inclusive) at the time of informed consent.
* Has a diagnosis of FXS with a confirmed FMR1 full mutation (â‰¥200 CGG repeats).

Exclusion Criteria:

* Concomitant disease or condition that are clinically significant and would limit study participation
* Clinically significant lab abnormalities or vital signs at the time of screening
* History of uncontrollable seizure disorder or seizure episodes within 6 months of screening or change in the anticonvulsant pharmacotherapy in the past 3 months.
* Unable or does not have a caregiver able to comply with study requirements.
* Enrolled in any clinical trial within the 30 days before screening.
